FAMR 0.0.11

Wrapper function to clump and merge SNPs

Source: R/utils.R
prune_and_merge.Rd

A simple wrapper function that performs LD clumping for SNPs in a locus, then subsets those SNPs, then merges the SNPs for this locus into an object collecting summary statistics over all loci. Used by gather_sumstats to read individual locus files into a single object in memory.

Usage

prune_and_merge(
  dat,
  sumstats,
  ld,
  prune_thresh,
  fa_prune_thresh,
  f_idx,
  oracle_mode = F
)

Arguments

dat

A list object formed from merging all previous loci, with the following elements:

betas

A matrix of estimated effect sizes of SNPs on exposures, with rows corresponding to SNPs and columns corresponding to exposures.

stderrs

A matrix of standard errors for the betas.

Z

A matrix of z-scores for the exposures, equal to betas divided by stderrs.

betas_y

A vector of estimated effect sizes of SNPs on the outcome.

stderrs_y

A vector of standard errors for betas_y.

zscores_y

A vector of z-scores of SNPs on the outcome, equal to betas_y divided by stderrs_y.

pos

A vector of SNP names.

locus_idx

A vector matching SNPs to which locus they come from, indexed in the order the loci are read from in_dir.

lambda

A matrix of lambda values learned by learn_lambda for each exposure in each locus, where each row of the matrix corresponds to a locus and the columns are the exposures.

ss_for_fa

A list object with the "betas", "stderrs", "Z", "weights", and "pos" fields, but only for the SNPs to be input to factor analysis.

sumstats

A list object in the same format as dat, but corresponding to the current locus

ld

A numertic LD matrix between the SNPs in sumstats (current locus)

prune_thresh

A numeric value between 0 and 1 indicating the LD clumping threshold to be used by ld_prune_famr

fa_prune_thresh

A numeric value between 0 and 1 indicating the LD clumping threshold to be used to generate a set of SNPs for input to factor analysis (FA)

f_idx

The current file index, used to indicate which locus the SNPs in sumstats come from

oracle_mode

DEPRECATED. Used for internal testing only.

Value

A list object in the same format as dat, containing the SNPs in both dat and those from sumstats that were not removed during LD clumping.
